files.Title: AlphaFramework.World
files.Summary: Provides a basis for building engine-agnostic models of game worlds.

AlphaFramework is a high-level game framework built on top of OmegaEngine. It provides an architecture for managing game worlds, logic, and presentation. Its design emphasizes clean separation of responsibilities.

files.Summary: Rendering-agnostic infrastructure used by OmegaEngine.

files.Summary: Helper methods for es and s.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.BufferUtils
files.Summary: Helper methods for creating, reading from and writing to s, s and attribute buffers.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.ArcballCamera
files.Summary:
A camera that orbits around a target point. Adjustable yaw, pitch, and roll. Panning the target respects the current yaw and roll.

Useful for building model viewers, character inspection screens, or turntable presentations.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.Camera
files.Summary: Determines the perspective from which a is displayed.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.CloneCamera
files.Summary: A camera that imitates the perspective of another .

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.FirstPersonCamera
files.Summary:
A camera that allows movement, yaw and pitch, but no roll. Movement in the XY-plane respects the current yaw but ignores the pitch (fixed "Up" vector).

Useful for building first-person or third-person games with ground-based movement.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.FreeFlyCamera
files.Summary:
A camera with free 6-degrees-of-freedom movement (movement and rotation in all directions).

Useful for building tools, debugging, or games with free-flying movement (space sims, spectator modes).

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.MatrixCamera
files.Summary: A camera that internally uses matrixes for representing rotations.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.QuaternionCamera
files.Summary: A camera that internally uses quaternions for representing rotations.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.ReflectCamera
files.Summary: A camera that reflects the perspective of another camera along a plane.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.StrategyCamera
files.Summary:
An overhead camera that allows panning across the map, rotating, and zooming in/out. The pitch angle is automatically adjusted based on the zoom level.

Useful for building RTS games, tactical games, or top-down views.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.TransitionCamera
files.Summary:
A camera that smoothly transitions between two camera states over time. Usually used via .

Useful for cinematic camera movements or smooth transitions between different viewpoints.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.TransitionCameraOptions
files.Summary: Options controlling a camera transition.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras.ZoomCamera
files.Summary: Common base class for cameras that support zooming.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Cameras
files.Summary: Cameras in OmegaEngine determine the perspective from which a is displayed in a .

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.DynamicShader
files.Summary: Helper class for dynamically generating code

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.GeneralShader
files.Summary: A general-purpose surface shader with optional support for normal and specular maps

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.LightingShader
files.Summary: A that properly reacts to s

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.PostBleachShader
files.Summary: A post-screen shader that bleaches out the colors.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.PostBlurShader
files.Summary: A post-screen shader that blurs the view using a Gaussian blur filter.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.PostCameraShakeShader
files.Summary: A post-screen shader that simulates a "shaking camera" effect.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.PostColorCorrectionShader
files.Summary: A post-screen shader for applying TV-like settings like brightness, contrast, hue, gamma, etc.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.PostGlowShader
files.Summary: A post-screen shader that adds a bloom-like glow-effect around objects in the scene.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.PostHaloShader
files.Summary: A post-screen shader that adds shining halos around objects in the scene.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.PostRadialBlurShader
files.Summary: A post-screen shader that blurs the view radially.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.PostScratchedFilmShader
files.Summary: A post-screen shader that creates "scratched film" effect.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.PostSepiaShader
files.Summary: A post-screen shader that creates an "old paper" look.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.PostShader
files.Summary: A shader that is applied to the complete scene after rendering.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.Shader
files.Summary: Provides access to the properties of shader-programm executing on the GPU.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.ShaderCompileException
files.Summary: Exception thrown when fails to compile FX code

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.SurfaceShader
files.Summary: A shader that controls the look of a 's surface

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.TerrainShader
files.Summary: A shader that blends multiple textures together

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders.WaterShader
files.Summary: A water surface shader

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.Shaders
files.Summary: Shaders are small pieces of code executed directly on the graphics card. They govern how vertexes are transformed and how each individual pixel color is calculated.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.SpecialView
files.Summary: A common base class for views that use non-standard rendering modes.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.SupportView
files.Summary: A common base class for all that provide support functionality like water refraction/reflection, glow maps, etc.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.TextureView
files.Summary: A special kind of that directs its output into a texture instead of printing straight to the screen.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.TexturedMesh
files.Summary: Methods for creating meshes of simple geometric shapes (box, sphere, etc.) with texture coordinates.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.TexturedMeshUtils
files.Summary: Utility method for textured es.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl.PositionColored
files.Summary: A fixed-function vertex format that stores position and color. Using this format hints the engine that that no lighting is to be used.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl.PositionColoredTextured
files.Summary: Not supported!

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl.PositionMultiTextured
files.Summary: A fixed-function vertex format that stores position, shadow information, texture blending weights and texture coordinates. Using this format hints the engine that normals and tangents still need to be calculated.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl.PositionNormalBinormalTangentTextured
files.Summary: A fixed-function vertex format that stores position, normals, binormals, tangents and texture coordinates. Using this format hints the engine that all necessary data is already present.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl.PositionNormalColored
files.Summary: A fixed-function vertex format that stores position, normals and color. Using this format hints the engine that that lighting is to be used.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl.PositionNormalMultiTextured
files.Summary: A custom vertex format that stores position, normals, shadow information, texture blending weights and texture coordinates. Using this format hints the engine that tangents (and maybe normals) still need to be calculated.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl.PositionNormalTextured
files.Summary: A fixed-function vertex format that stores position, normals and texture coordinates. Using this format hints the engine that tangents (and maybe normals) still need to be calculated.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl.PositionTextured
files.Summary: A fixed-function vertex format that stores position and texture coordinates. Using this format hints the engine that normals and tangents still need to be calculated.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl.TransformedColored
files.Summary: A fixed-function vertex format that stores a transformed position and color.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl.TransformedColoredTextured
files.Summary: A fixed-function vertex format that stores a transformed position, color and texture coordinates.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl.TransformedTextured
files.Summary: A fixed-function vertex format that stores a transformed position and texture coordinates.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.VertexDecl
files.Summary: Structs mapped to DirectX custom vertex formats (for storing additional information per vertex).

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.View
files.Summary: Controls the rendering of a using a .

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.WaterView
files.Summary: A for rendering refractions or reflections

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics.XMaterial
files.Summary: A combination of textures and lighting parameters.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Graphics
files.Summary: Graphics subsystem of the engine.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Hardware
files.Summary: Information about the hardware the is running on.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.IPositionable
files.Summary: An interface to objects that have a position.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.IRenderHost
files.Summary: A host that provides an instance and binds it to the operating system.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input.ActionReceiver
files.Summary: Calls a callback delegate whenever any kind of input is received.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input.IInputReceiver
files.Summary: An object that receives input from an .

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input.InputProvider
files.Summary: Processes events from an input device into higher-level navigational commands.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input.InputReceiverBase
files.Summary: Base class to simplify implementing

files.Summary: Processes keyboard events into higher-level navigational commands.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input.MouseAction
files.Summary: An action bound to a mouse input.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input.MouseAreaSelection
files.Summary: A rectangular selection action bound to a mouse input.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input.MouseInputProvider
files.Summary: Processes mouse events into higher-level navigational commands.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input.MouseInputScheme
files.Summary: Controls which mouse button does what.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input.MouseNavigation
files.Summary: A navigation action bound to a mouse input.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input.MouseNavigationAxis
files.Summary: An axis / degree-of-freedom manipulatable by mouse.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input.TouchInputProvider
files.Summary: Processes touch events into higher-level navigational commands.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Input
files.Summary: OmegaEngine provides a flexible input system that processes low-level input events into higher-level navigational commands. The system consists of s that capture input and s that respond to commands.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.Profiler
files.Summary: Helper class with static functions to signal the beginnings and endings of performance profiling events. In Debug builds events are also passed to PIX.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.ProfilerEvent
files.Summary: Struct that allows you to profile timed execution blocks.

files.Summary: An internal Windows Form to use as render target with mouse+keyboard event handling

files.Summary: Automatically provides an instance with a fullscreen-capable window, render loop, input handling, etc.

files.Title: OmegaEngine.RenderHostExtensions
files.Summary: Contains extension methods for .

files.Title: OmegaEngine.RenderPanel
files.Summary: A that automatically provides an instance for rendering on it, an optional timer-driver render loop, input handling, etc.

files.Summary: 3D graphics rendering based on DirectX 9.
